To help make it easier for us to investigate your issue, please follow the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-issues).

issue.title: Handle in-app-purchase less fatally on non-Darwin

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
Fixes https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/12471

Right now it throws a new error when the file is even `require()d`, but this isn't ideal as there are cases where everything is mass-required, such as Spectron.

Instead, we should throw an error on non-Darwin environments only when the IAP methods are invoked.

body: Bah. I was cleaning my copy/paste buffer and it went off.

issue.title: Change in audio output default device in the system is not reflected inside the electron

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.title: Default audio device not respected on some devices
issue.body:
I've been having this issue for quite some time now and decided to make an issue to see if I'm the only one experiencing this.

## Description
Whenever I select my monitor as an audio output device, all caprine sounds still output through my internal speakers. So if I mute my monitor sound (when the monitor is the default audio device), it will still play sounds through the internal Macbook speakers.

I tested if it was any other tool I'm using (MonitorControl would be a possible candidate for causing issues) but it wasn't. I'm thinking this might be an electron bug? It only seems to happen with my monitor, I tested it with my Airpods and it seemed to be fine. 

## Steps to reproduce
1. Set monitor as default audio device (mine uses displayport)
2. Mute monitor sound
3. Trigger notification
--> The sound will still output through internal Macbook speakers.

I'm sure this won't be reproducible for everyone, but I'm pretty sure it's either electron or caprine. 

Anyone else experiencing this? Any ideas what it could be? Let me know if you want my to test some other stuff.

<hr>
Caprine 2.30.2 (2.30.2.1338)

macOS 10.14.4

I've been having this issue for several macOS and Caprine versions though (as long as I can remember)

body:
Thank you for taking the time to report this issue and helping to make Electron better.

The version of Electron you reported this on has been superseded by newer releases. 

If you're still experiencing this issue in Electron v4.2.x or later, please add a comment specifying the version you're testing with and any other new information that a maintainer trying to reproduce the issue should know.

I'm setting the `blocked/need-info` label for the above reasons. This issue will be closed 7 days from now if there is no response.

Thanks in advance! Your help is appreciated.

Thank you for your issue!

We haven't gotten a response to our questions in our comment above. With only the information that is currently in the issue, we don't have enough information to take action. I'm going to close this but don't hesitate to reach out if you have or find the answers we need, we'll be happy to reopen the issue.
